translations.translation: and Pharaoh of the Stakes,
And the mighty Pharaoh
And with Pharaoh of the tent pegs
(Also consider the people of) the Pharaoh who victimized people by placing them on the stake,
And with Firaun, who used to crucify.
And Fir`awn with Al-Awtad
And (with) Firon, the lord of hosts,
and Pharaoh, he of the tent-pegs,
And with Pharaoh, firm of might,
and with Pharaoh of the stakes?
And with Fir'awn, owner of the stakes -
and Pharaoh, the impaler
And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes?
And (with) Fir'aun (Pharaoh), who had pegs (who used to torture men by binding them to pegs)?
And Pharaoh, of the pegs (impaling his victims)?
And Pharaoh of the Stakes.
And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -
[89:10] and Pharaoh, the one of the tent-pegs: he used to fasten four pegs and tie to these the hands and feet of those whom he tortured —

(And with Pharaoh) and how He destroyed Pharaoh, (firm of right) Pharaoh erected four pillars to which he tied and tortured anyone with whom he was angry until the latter died, as he did with his wife Asiyah Bint Muzahim,

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِى ٱلأَوْتَادِ } معناه فانهُ بَنى مناراً يَذبحُ عليهِ النّاسَ فسُمِّي ذا الأَوتادِ

translations.translation: And the saying of Allah {And Pharaoh, of the Stakes} means that he built a platform on which people would be sacrificed, so he was called "of the Stakes."

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَفِرْعَوْنَ } الطاغي الباغي { ذِى ٱلأَوْتَادِ } [الفجر: 10] أي: ذي العسكر الكثير
 المشتمل على المضارب والخيام
 المشتملة على الأوتاد والأطناب


وهؤلاء المذكورين هم: { ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوْاْ فِي ٱلْبِلاَدِ } [الفجر: 11] واستكبروا على ضعفاء العباد اتكالاً بما عندهم من المَّال والجاه والثروة والسيادة
